The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by distinctive fruits that are initially green and gradually turn a pale yellow as they mature. Due to its limited geographic distribution and specific ecological requirements, Mespilus chlorosarca is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
